comments:
I20070807-0010.

When I export the refactoring scripts of all my projects I get tons of .log entries (246KB!) but zero feedback in the UI.

The .log contains always the same entry without telling where it comes from (see bug 199017):

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring 4 10006 2007-08-07 10:36:57.341
!MESSAGE The xml file contained invalid values

This is caused by a SAXException while parsing the xml file. It would really help to say which file...
Markus, do you know where this xml files are stored? 

It works fine for me btw.

Fixed in RefactoringSessionReader.

Dani's workspace contained old refactoring descriptors which also contained redundant 'project' attributes. I recently added detection for such problems -- needed to relax this a bit.

Also improved logging behavior (log file name and position of errors).

Reopening for final fixes in M2.

Need to
- add feedback in the UI if something fails
- tweak the bogus SAXParseException, which pretends to support exception chaining, but in the end just swallows the stacktrace of the original exception :-(
- decide whether JavaRefactoringDescriptorUtil.getBoolean(..) could be relaxed to just return false in case an attribute is not available

See Dani's log below after the latest fix.
